entities.name: christmas
entities.description: Christmas is mentioned as an event that Harry returns to. The text describes the atmosphere of happiness and relief associated with it.

entities.name: sirius
entities.description: Sirius is described as a character who is delighted at having the house full again and especially at having Harry back. He is mentioned as singing 'God Rest Ye Merry, Hippogriffs'.

entities.name: buckbeak
entities.description: Buckbeak is mentioned as a hippogriff that Sirius is visiting in his room.

entities.name: privet drive
entities.description: Privet Drive is described as Harry's home where he returns for Christmas.

entities.name: hogwarts
entities.description: Hogwarts is mentioned as a place where students would have enjoyed themselves more than at Privet Drive.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is described as returning to Privet Drive for Christmas and being welcomed back by Sirius.

relationships.description: Sirius visits Buckbeak in his room, singing 'God Rest Ye Merry, Hippogriffs'.
Sirius welcomes Harry back to Privet Drive for Christmas.
Sirius hosts a Christmas celebration at Privet Drive, decorating the house and working tirelessly with the help of others.
Harry compares his experience at Privet Drive to Hogwarts.
